result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda J Douglas

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver filed by Atty Jason Lockery

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:28 PM Defendant Amanda J Douglas in court.  Attorney Jason Matthew Lockery in court for Amanda J Douglas.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Lockery provides the Court with a written waiver of preliminary hearing.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No contact with Menards in Plover

2:00 PM Defendant Amanda J Douglas in court.  Attorney Jason Matthew Lockery in court for Amanda J Douglas.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Atty Lockery is ready to waive the preliminary hearing.
Court informs Atty Lockery that because they are behind the Court will set for a Preliminary Hearing and Atty Lockery can file his written waiver and they can then remove the PH from the calendar and set it for an Arraignment. 

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

BY THE COURT:  
Atty Lockery to file a written waiver of preliminary hearing and when filed then set for an arraignment.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Jason Matthew Lockery
